Name: Staking module for Pioneer - v1
Description: A user friendly dashboard for staking and nominating that will make it far easier to identify verified validators to stake tokens towards for rewards.

Name: Builders WG Compensation Plan
Description: A new compensation and process plan for our builders WG

Name: BASE Bridge (Ethereum L2)
Description: Development & deployment of a bridging solution on Joystream that will allow for interoperability with Ethereum’s L2 BASE. In this first version, the goal would be to make JOY accessible on BASE as an ERC20 token. This would allow JOY to be traded, custodied and used with a much wider set of tools.

Name: Burning of council budget / treasury
Description: Due to the council budget being extremely large, it was decided by the council to burn 25m $JOY tokens

Name: Discord Role Bot
Description: A bot which automatically assigns on-chain roles to Discord users

Name: Discord Onboarding Flow
Description: Activate the onboarding flow for Discord

Name: Kusama/Polkadot Parachain
Description: Becoming a Kusama parachain would make sense for Joystream because it would provide enhanced security, interoperability, governance, community-building opportunities, exposure, partnerships, and credibility, which are all essential for any marketing effort.

Name: Video Communities - v1
Description: Launching a new application for your community using Atlas currently requires a lot of deep technical knowledge. You have to obtain hosting and a domain, start the service, configure it, and then maintain it. This is quite difficult. The goal of this milestone is to create the Reddit to phpBB, in terms of the experience of a prospective community creator and moderator. One requires substantially more work and skill. By instead offering a fully hosted and simple point-and-click feature, we can make it orders of magnitude easier to allow third parties to invite their communities to use Joystream.

Name: Content Infrastructure: Authentication & Authorisation
Description: Proper monetization, both for the DAO and individual creators, depends on being able to practically restrict access to content, or make access conditional. Currently, the infrastructure has no awareness of who the consumer is, or the semantics around what the content is, or any associated authorization policy. The goal of this milestone is to introduce basic authentication and authorization at the content layer, enforced by content delivery nodes. This will allow features such as gating videos to only NFT holders for example.

Name: Fiat On/Off Ramp
Description: Getting started with Joystream in one of our consumer apps is super easy, as you are floated a small initial balance of tokens you can only use for transaction fees. However, there are plenty of features which do require more substantial quantities of tokens, such as buying NFTs or Creator Tokens, and conversely, as a creator you are likely eager to not only have the native token, but to cash out to Fiat. For both of these reasons we are working on introducing a proper in-app on/off ramp for consumers and creators of an Atlas app. There are many great ramp partners, such as Transak, which have robust low-friction buy/sell widgets for crypto using credit cards, Apple/Google pay, from across a large number of jurisdictions.

Name: Playlists
Description: A key primitive for organizing content is through playlists. We have developed designs and metadata formats for this a long time ago, but in this milestone we will finally ship the ability for publishing and consuming playlists.

Name: Content Infrastructure: Performance V1
Description: Having very low latency of content delivery is a critical requirement for any social content product that involves users navigating across lots of different content over time. This depends on having well configured nodes with appropriate technical specifications, and most importantly - properly architecture node software. With the benefit of prior work on visibility we will have a solid foundation for ensuring that we can reach industry benchmarks for video content delivery, and that is the goal of this milestone.

Name: Content Infrastructure: Visibility - Completed
Description: With greater utilisation and scale, it has become clear that there is a need for better visibility into errors and performance levels at different layers of the infrastructure. This means both capturing data from the consumer and infrastructure layer, and also synthetically probing infrastructure to detect problems as early as possible. Currently, there is quite poor visibility into the performance of infrastructure, and the experience of users in interacting with this infrastructure. The goal of this milestone is to ship a set of integrations and standards for core infrastructure nodes, like Argus, Orion, to facilitate such visibility.

Name: Content Search V2
Description: Searching across videos and channels, and also doing search within channels or content categories, is important for effective discovery. Currently, Orion has very rudimentary full text natural language matching on titles and descriptions, but it is very brittle and naive, and often misses the mark. The goal of this milestone is to ship proper modern search capabilities.

Name: Content Recommendations V2
Description: Surfacing personalized content for a consumer is a key requirement for any content platform. Key product experiences like home screens, feeds and related content, all depend on having modern Machine learning based content recommendation system. Currently Orion has no infrastructure to produce or serve such recommendations, and app recommendations are being done entirely client-side. The goal of this milestone is to ship the first recommendation capability in Orion, to make Joystream apps much more

Name: DAO Creator Channel Payout Tooling Improvements
Description: Improvements to the tooling for our Channel Payout Proposal feature which will allow for the DAO to coordinate rewards to channel owners more regularly and at a larger scale.

Name: New Wallets - v2
Description: Implementations with external wallet providers such as hardware & software wallet providers (Tangem, Ledger)

Name: Block Explorer: Add balances and transfers to Calamar
NFT Improvements - Part 1
Description: The first in a series of improvements for our NFT functionality which will include the ability to make offers for unlisted NFTs, hide and unhide NFTs, “add NFTs to cart” as well as send NFTs to other users directly.

Name: Curator Tools
Description: Tooling to improve workflow for content curators

Name: Joystream Discord Tip Bot
Description: Completed - awaiting review likely delivery within November

Name: Block Explorer
Description: The task is to build and deploy an MVP of a dedicated Joystream block explorer with basic functionalities like showing balance, transaction, extrinsics, events and blocks.

Name: Creator Tokens (CRT)
Description: Creator tokens is a key financial, value capture and community growth primitive unlocked by Joystream. It allows creator to issue a fungible token which captures revenue generated by their channel, and distributes a share of it pro-rate with token holders. There are also complementary features around bootstrapping liquidity, raising funds through a public sale, and also managing access and vesting. This functionality has already been implemented in the blockchain and indexing infrastructure, and very mature designs have already been designed, what remains is to ship a fully working experience which productises this.

Name: Infographics & Educational content (tutorials, video explainers etc) - Part 1
Joystream SDK
Description: Building on top of Joystream today is still a challenging experience. There are no robust libraries or builder documentation for application development. Offering an excellent experience for developer to build apps, and not just use Atlas off-the shelf, will require a significant investment in building out the SDK. This milestone has as a goal to extract the core of key existing applications, like Atlas and Pioneer, and then to synthesize it all into a new core developer experience, with a suite of excellent tutorials, documentation, examples and also active outreach.

Name: New Exchange Listings - Completed
Description: Outreach & discussions with additional cryptocurrency exchanges to provide users with more options for trading the JOY token.

Name: Premium Content gating features (pay to view)
Description: This feature will allow for content creators to restrict access for content to users unless they pay a fee, enabling another revenue stream for premium content.

Name: Sponsored Transactions
Description: A gateway or channel can sponsor users so that their TXs are free (free comments, free uploads etc)—refill 5 $JOY locked starting deposit via server

Name: Transcoding & Adaptive Streaming
Description: Users access content across a wide range of browser, devices, applications and also under heterogeneous and dynamic bandwidth constraints. As it stands, only a single version of each media asset is represented in our metadata standards and backend node software. This means have now way to represent a broad range of encodings and resolutions for media assets, let alone produce all of these. Introducing server-side transcoding in Orion will unlock this, and many other future benefits that come from server-side post-processing (thumbnail extractions, auto-subtitling, etc.). It will also unlock the ability to do adaptive streaming, where a user with a dynamic connection can more quickly see asset resolve and play, and also be able to watch videos under suboptimal circumstances.

Name: Automated copyrighted content detection
Description: In the case someone uploads copyrighted content on the DAO, there should be a way to detect it, so the actual creator of the copyrighted material can monetize, even before they register with the platform. I say this because once Joystream gets popular over time, there will be some infringers that will try to take advantage. This is something that happened to YouTube prior to Google's acquisition

Name: Non-Video Content Uploads
Description: Improvements to the current content upload system which will enable users to upload more formats such as audio, podcasts and image files.

Name: Bounties v2
Description: Development & deployment of an on-chain bounty management module that will enable bounties to be posted and crowdfunded by users including oracle selection and reward splitting. The council will also have the unique feature of being able to fund bounties that it selects for being of benefit to the platform via the council treasury.

Name: Joystream CLI Improvements
Description: Look through github for some relevant improvements to add here - tomato. General usability improvements.

Name: Multiple mints of NFTs
Description: when it comes to NFTs, I want to add in the thread that 1) we should mint more than one copy of the same NFT as a personal option, and 2) offer free NFTs to others to promote oneself. I feel like these two ideas would marry perfectly.

Name: dApp/gateway operator grants + support
Description: Development of a grants program to attract dApp operators and developers to build on the Joystream platform and build our ecosystem.

Name: Colossus support of object storage (similar to awscloud and Filebase)
Content Delivery Improvements - V1 - Completed
Description: The first in a series of improvements aimed at increasing the speed and reliability of content delivery to users. This will also include tooling to measure the speed of the current content delivery network (CDN) infrastructure so that it can be further improved upon in later iterations.

Name: Pay to access gated channel
Description: would require

Name: Premium Video Comments & Tips
Description: Add functionality for users to leave comments on videos with a tip attached to them that will be sent to the channel owner. This will also enable functionality for users to tip channels and videos directly.

NFT “offer” for unlisted NFTs

Name: Hide or Unhide NFT anytime
Description: On Opensea, you can hide or unhide any NFT all the time. On Gleev/L1.media, after you mint a video into NFT, you won't be able to change its visibility at all.

Name: Runtime changes
Description: Per Bedeho - calls are currently filtered. At minimum a runtime upgrade needs to remove the filtering, but it sounds like an audit of the bounty module would be required for this module to work again.

Name: Advertising module
Products: Bounty Module, Pioneer, Query Node, Runtime
Description: Similar to bounty module. “Paying $100 to channels with >50k subs who put this 15 second promo clip at the start of a video”

Name: Subscan
Description: JSG is considering paying for the subscan explorer integration. This is pending based upon what the DAO can accomplish with some of the open source block explorers that are available for substrate projects.

Name: Pioneer Working Group Management Module
Description: Adds functionality to Pioneer which allow for our working groups to create and manage job openings, hire and fire workers as well as adjust worker salaries more easily. This will reduce the technical knowledge required to use the DAO and increase the appeal of Joystream in areas such as marketing and outreach.

Name: Metrics showing TX + extr. count per day + per term
Council Size + Duration
Description: Discussion and ideally consensus on adjusting the council election parameters which can change the size, duration and minimum requirements for candidate stake.

Name: Pioneer Email Notifications - Completed
Description: Email notifications for on-chain events, like election stages or forum mentions can greatly enhance user interactivity with Pioneer and Joystream in general.

Name: Mobile design for Pioneer - Completed
Description: A responsive web design (RWD) for Pioneer that will allow it to be more easily accessed via smartphones and tablets.

Name: Creator Ambassador Program
Description: The creation and management of the Ambassador program will empower influencers to leverage their platforms, amplifying awareness about the Joystream protocol, and driving engagement and adoption

Name: Bounties Program
Description: Creation and management of bounties encompassing a variety of interest areas such as marketing, development, research and range in scope and are a great way to get new users involved with the project.

Name: Discord Community Moderators
Description: A list of trusted community members to have moderation powers on our Discord

Name: Stablecoin Treasury - Completed
Description: Building a stablecoin treasury that is managed by a multisig group of representatives that Joystream’s council have elected. This stablecoin treasury will allow for the DAO to pay 3rd parties for infrastructure services and exchange listings and more.

Name: Progressive Web App for Atlas/Gleev
Description: Development of a progressive web app for Atlas/Gleev that will allow for the app to be installed on user’s smartphones without having to go through app stores.

Name: Block explorer improvements (for subscan)
Description: find github issue for “Subscan suggestions” on joystream monorepo

Name: Staking Nomination Pools
Description: Implementation of on-chain nomination pools which will allow for users to far more easily and quickly stake the JOY token for pooled rewards from other users. This will also provide an important revenue stream for wallet developers and make the Joystream project more attractive to be featured on wallets.

Name: Pioneer Forum labels + proposal label system
Description: A labeling system that will help to link together the hundreds of proposals and forum threads that our governance system has already generated. This will make navigation and sharing information significantly improved.

Name: Governance Tooling
Description: Automated council report scripts, WG lead report scripts

Name: Gleev Recommended Content - V1 - Completed
Description: Improving the landing page experience for Gleev users so that more varied and higher quality content is given preference.

Name: Metamask Snap Development
Description: Development of a “Metamask Snap”, this would allow Metamask users to store, receive and send $JOY tokens.

Name: Project Overview Dashboard
Description: A purpose built data-driven dashboard to explain the project’s current status, growth and market positioning. This will be on the main project website and make it easy & quick for people to understand how the platform is going.

Name: Pioneer Financials Page - V1
Description: A new module for Pioneer that will show the current financials of the DAO, which will show data for spending and accounting for the council and all working groups.

Name: Content Curator Tooling
Description: Improved tooling for our Content Curator Working Group that will allow for them to better handle the large amount of uploads they manage each day.

Name: Automated Thumbnail Generation
Description: Automatic creation of thumbnails when users upload videos to Gleev or Atlas enabling a more seamless upload experience for content creators.

Name: Governance Tooling
Description: Tooling and the creation of scripts to enable our elected Council Members and Working Groups be capable of generating budget and other reports more easily.

Name: Joystream CLI Improvements
Description: Various quality of life improvements to our command-line interface (CLI) tool that will allow for work on the DAO to be completed more easily.

Name: New Exchange Listings
Description: Outreach & discussions with additional cryptocurrency exchanges to provide users with more options for trading the JOY token.

Name: New Exchange Listings
Description: Outreach & discussions with additional cryptocurrency exchanges to provide users with more options for trading the JOY token.

Description: Outreach & discussions with additional cryptocurrency exchanges to provide users with more options for trading the JOY token.

Name: API-less YouTube Sync
Description: This functionality would enable for channels to sync to Joystream via our YouTube Partner Program without relying on YouTube’s API.

Name: Wallet implementations - v1 - Completed
Description: we were added to Onekey (hardware wallet) as well as Nova wallet, novaspektr, polkadot vault

Name: New Exchange Listings
Description: Outreach & discussions with additional cryptocurrency exchanges to provide users with more options for trading the JOY token.

Name: Luxor network upgrade
Description: Luxor is a planned network runtime upgrade that will enable several features such as vested payments to workers, council budget reductions, validator reward adjustments as well as adding a proposal for adjusting Creator Token parameters.

Name: Creator Rewards Program
Description: Objective of the program is to offer creators a broader range of activities to be rewarded for. Overall the focus of rewards is shifting from rewards for syncing to holistic engagement and driving the platform growth. As part of the rewards program creators are offered the opportunity to maximize rewards by posting original content to Gleev App ahead of other platforms, and further with utilizing Gleev branding assets. Promoting their channel's NFTs and Tokens on social media and actively participating in the creator's community opens up more additional opportunities for monetizing engagement with Joystream platform.

Name: Ambassador Program Expansion / v2
Description: Further expansion of our Ambassador program which will include more recruitment and funding for content and engagement by creators.

Name: Social Collaboration Features
Description: The power of Web3 is in the community ownership and leveraging the network effects. Gleev will offer new ways to organise community based on content verticals and individual channels, adding more utility and new use cases for Creator Tokens and Joy tokens. Channel token holders will be offered exclusive ways to connect with creators, and social feed will empower viewers to co-curate the platform's trending content, gain exposure on the platform and earn JOY tokens for active participation.

Name: Creator Token Improvements
Description: Various improvements to creator token functionality such as public sales, whitelisting and transfer of creator tokens.

Name: Native Mobile App Development
Description: Development of a native mobile app for major smartphone platforms.

Name: Partnerships with Layer3, Blum, Base (quests for points to attract users)
Description: Suggested on forums

Name: Cloudflare stream features
Description: Suggested on forums - incorporate cloudflare stream as secondary cache and also add other features like encoding, subtitle generation etc

Description: TLDR: the proposal is to abandon the video platform aspect and become a bounty board for sponsors/companies to connect with and pay content creators
